page.title: 12Biography
page.content: {My Mum's Life at Saint Clidan My memories of school are very happy. The school was unusual because it was inside two large houses.One at the top and the other half way down a steep hill.It was necessary to go from one to the other for lessons and in the W inter you had to struggle up or slide down to school.Sliding down was best.We sat on wooden benches two at a desk,one girl and one boy at each.How_ ever during the Winter coal fires were lit and we could all gather near the heat for our lessons.During games lessons you had to climb throughthe treesand swing from the branches. when Autumn came we were allowed to pick as many pears as we wanted if we asked first.Any pupil could have a small plot of landto grow flowers and vegtables.Sadly the school no longer exists but it always in my memory.....
